meanings.sent1: The dirty water will taint the clean stream.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to taint the food with harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally taint the soup with too much salt, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The negative news seemed to taint the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti taints the beauty of the historic building.

meanings.definition: A trace of a bad or undesirable quality
meanings.sent1: There was a taint of dishonesty in his explanation.
meanings.sent2: The taint of corruption lingered in the government.
meanings.sent3: The taint of burnt popcorn filled the room after a kitchen mishap.
meanings.sent4: The taint of jealousy colored her words with bitterness.
meanings.sent5: The taint of smoke clung to his clothes after the bonfire.

meanings.definition: To affect with a trace of something bad or undesirable
meanings.sent1: His negative attitude can taint the whole team.
meanings.sent2: Gossip can easily taint someone's reputation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to taint the freshly painted wall.
meanings.sent4: The scandal taints the image of the company.
meanings.sent5: The false accusation taints the trust between friends.
